string.name: settingsGeneral
string.instruction: List item for general settings

resources.string: DuckDuckGo Private Search is your default search engine, so you can search the web without being tracked.
Customize your search language, region, and more
Show search suggestions as you type, including your bookmarks. All searches are private.
Show recently visited sites in search suggestions. Recently visited sites are private, only stored on your device, and can be cleared with the Fire Button.
Autocomplete Suggestions now include your recently visited sites. Turn off in Settings, or clear anytime with the 🔥 Fire Button.

string.name: generalSettingsActivityTitle
string.instruction: Title of the general settings screen

resources.string: DuckDuckGo never tracks you and we aim to protect your privacy as much as possible. We continually maintain and develop layers of protection to keep up with new tracking methods and provide many protections that other browsers don’t offer by default. Learn More

DuckDuckGo is the independent Internet privacy company founded in 2008 for anyone who’s tired of being tracked online and wants an easy solution. We’re proof you can get real privacy protection online without tradeoffs.

The DuckDuckGo browser comes with the features you expect from a go-to browser, like bookmarks, tabs, passwords, and more, plus over a dozen powerful privacy protections not offered in most popular browsers by default. This uniquely comprehensive set of privacy protections helps protect your online activities, from searching to browsing, emailing, and more.

Our privacy protections work without having to know anything about the technical details or deal with complicated settings. All you have to do is switch your browser to DuckDuckGo across all your devices and you get privacy by default.

But if you do want a peek under the hood, you can find more information about how DuckDuckGo privacy protections work on our help pages
Submitting an anonymous broken site report helps us improve the app.
Can\'t pay, check out, or shop
Site asked me to disable ad blocker
Comments, reviews, or chats didn\'t load
What happened? What should have happened? Did turning protections off help?
Protections are ON for this site
Protections are OFF for this site
We temporarily turned Privacy Protections off as they appear to be breaking this site.

string.name: brokenSiteReportDataShowDetailsButton
string.instruction: This is on a button that allows users to view details on what kind of data is collected with their feedback report

resources.string:
Info sent in reports can\'t be used to identify you:

• Page URL (without identifiable info)
• Device make, model, and manufacturer
• Operating system version number
• App version number
• Anonymous experiment group for feature testing
• Information about which versions of our protections were active
• Web browser engine version number
• List of which protections and browser features were active
• Hostnames of trackers blocked, surrogate requests, ignored requests, and requests not in tracker blocking list
• Browser-reported errors
• Website response status (HTTP) codes
• Which reporting form you used ("menu", "dashboard", etc.)
• Date of last report sent for this site
• Whether or not you opted to show this report info
• Number of times protections were toggled off
• How quickly parts of the page loaded
• How you got to this page, either: "SERP" (DuckDuckGo search), "Navigation" (link/URL), or "External" (other means)
• Number of refreshes since page load
• Primary language and country of your device

Your anonymous feedback is important to us.
Thanks for choosing DuckDuckGo!\nNow, when using our search or app, your searches are protected.

You\'re now blocking trackers across the web 🎉

I can also block trackers hiding in your other apps, even when you aren\'t using your phone.

The Internet can be kinda creepy.

Not to worry! Searching and browsing privately is easier than you think.

As you tap and scroll, I\'ll block pesky trackers.

Go ahead — keep browsing!

string.name: daxMainNetworkCtaText
string.instruction: %1$s is the name of a company, %2$s is the website where the tracking is happening, %3$s is the name of the company showing in %1$s

resources.string:
Heads up! I can\'t stop %1$s from seeing your activity on %2$s

But browse with me, and I can reduce what %3$s knows about you overall by blocking their trackers on lots of other sites.

string.name: daxMainNetworkOwnedCtaText
string.instruction: %1$s is the name of a company, %2$s is the website where the tracking is happening, %3$s is the name of the company showing in %1$s

resources.string:
Heads up! Since %1$s owns %2$s, I can\'t stop them from seeing your activity here.

But browse with me, and I can reduce what %3$s knows about you overall by blocking their trackers on lots of other sites.

string.name: preciseLocationSiteDialogTitle
string.instruction: Placeholder is the name of a website

resources.string: We only use your anonymous location to deliver better results, closer to you. You can always change your mind later.
You can manage the location access permissions you’ve granted to individual sites in Settings.

Sites you visit may ask to know your device location. They won\'t be able to access it until you explicitly grant permission. DuckDuckGo only uses your location anonymously to deliver local search results.
Sites Can Ask for My Location
No websites granted permission to access location
To manage the location access permissions you\’ve granted to individual sites, enable location for this app in Android Settings.

resources.string: Would you like us to send you a notification when it\'s your turn?

string.name: sslErrorHeadline
string.instruction: Placeholder is domain with certificate issues

resources.string: The certificate for this site is invalid. You might be connecting to a server that is pretending to be %1$s which could put your confidential information at risk.
DuckDuckGo warns you when a website has an invalid certificate.

string.name: sslErrorExpiredMessage
string.instruction: Placeholder is domain with certificate issues

resources.string: The security certificate for %1$s is expired. It’s possible that the website is misconfigured, that an attacker has compromised your connection, or that your system clock is incorrect.

string.name: sslErrorWrongHostMessage
string.instruction: Placeholder is domain with certificate issues

resources.string: The security certificate for %1$s does not match *.%2$s. It’s possible that the website is misconfigured or that an attacker has compromised your connection, or that your system clock is incorrect.

string.name: sslErrorUntrustedMessage
string.instruction: Placeholder is domain with certificate issues

resources.string: The security certificate for %1$s is not trusted by your device\'s operating system. It’s possible that the website is misconfigured or that an attacker has compromised your connection, or that your system clock is incorrect.
